alert.note: Alert for East Turnagain Arm; Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 14 at 4:59AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BANDS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS TO CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING WITH AREAS OF BLOWING SNOW LATE THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... Bands of moderate to heavy snow showers will continue across the Seward Highway Corridor from Girdwood and Whittier south through Turnagain Pass to the Hope Cutoff through Thursday morning with an additional 1 to 3 inches of accumulation possible. Snowfall rates in heavier snow showers could reach up to one inch per hour, leading to significantly reduced visibility at times. Westerly winds gusting up to 25 mph will develop late Thursday morning along the Seward Highway from Girdwood to Portage resulting in localized areas of blowing snow and reduced visibilities. Gusty winds and blowing snow are also likely along the Portage Glacier Road to Whittier.

area.areaDesc: East Turnagain Arm; Western Prince William Sound
